item.title: Did you know Vipps is more than peer to peer payment? #Backend #Java # Golang at First Engineers (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
For Client: Vipps
Location: Oslo


In Vipps we're on a mission to make life easier for people and businesses through smart payments.

We started out as an initiative at one of Norway's largest banks with simplifying peer-to-peer payments and replaced your account number with your phone number. In six months, we reached a million downloads. Today half of Norway's population use Vipps. Last year we became a company of our own, owned by more than 100 Norwegian banks, and currently we are working on drastically simplifying the way people and businesses do payments. 

That being said, we are far from finished with growing our product portfolio!

Our backend systems run in container services on the public cloud. They are mainly written in Java, Go and Python, but we strive to use the best tool for the job without getting religious in our technical choices.


We are looking for developers with a strong background in Java as well as experience and interest in other programming languages. We value automation, simplicity, and attention to details. We loathe too many meetings, too many stakeholders and excessive planning. If you recognise yourself so far and you believe in the merits of hypothesis-driven experimentation, continuous deployment and validated learning we are on a good note already!


To sum it all up we feel like a startup with the benefits and stability of a large institution. Here you will spend most your time on new developments and exciting new products.


We do know that you most probably already have a job you are more than OK with. Therefore, we have made an application process which also reflects our name. Try it out and VIPPS we may be teaming up soon!

item.title: React-utvikler at RiksTV AS (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
For RiksTVs nye TV-satsninger ser vi etter en talentfull og dyktig React-utvikler. Du vil bidra til å ta våre TV-opplevelser på nett til nye høyder.


Vi har i dag et høykompetent team som jobber på dette området. Teamet er preget av nysgjerrige og initiativrike personer som er sterke innen sitt fagfelt. De utfordrer og styrker hverandres kompetanse. Teamene er i dag samlokaliserte på vårt hovedkontor på Økern.


Her på Økern jobber vi tett og godt sammen etter smidige prinsipper og metodikker fra Lean Startup. Det er viktig for oss at du er en utpreget lagspiller, og du må dele vår filosofi rundt smidig arbeidsmåte. Vi vil ha deg med på laget hvis du er ivrig til å lære og ikke er redd for å prøve og feile før du oppnår det ønskede resultatet.


Kompetanse som vi trenger


Et absolutt minimum er erfaring med:



  • React.js og Redux

  • God kjennskap til software design patterns og arkitektur

  • Skrive ryddig og lesbar kode


Videre er det en stor fordel at du har kjennskap til: 



  • React-native

  • Video streaming

  • Continuous integration and delivery


Hva vi leter etter


Vi søker deg som har gründerånd. Vi verdsetter at du er en pådriver, har stor kapasitet, er kreativ og løsningsorientert. Til gjengjeld vil vi gi deg stor frihet til å prege både produkt og konsept slik du ønsker. Du er av natur en som søker tilbakemeldinger fra sluttbrukere og er komfortabel med å gjennomføre intervjuer, brukertester og målinger av ulike slag og format.


Det er viktig for oss at du har gode muntlige fremstillingsevner (norsk og engelsk) og at du har en utpreget analytisk tankegang. Du har utdannelse på masternivå med gode karakterer eller erfaring og resultater som oppveier for manglende utdannelsenivå. 


Hva vi tilbyr


Hos oss vil du få en utfordrende og spennende hverdag med produkter som er synlige og engasjerende for brukerne. Vi er en kompetansebedrift med gode utviklingsmuligheter, og vi ønsker å legge til rette for at du skal bli en av de beste i markedet på ditt område. 


Vi holder til i røffe og moderne lokaler på Økern. Her har vi en stor takterrasse med bordtennisbord og vi har en fantastisk kantine med vår egen kokk og shuffleboard. Vi har treningsrom i kjeller og vi har generelt topp moderne møterom. Arbeidsmiljøet hos oss er ungt, godt sosialt og vi har takhøyde.

item.title: iOS-/tvOS-utvikler at RiksTV AS (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
For RiksTVs nye TV-satsninger ser vi etter en talentfull og dyktig iOS- og/eller tvOS-utvikler. Du vil bidra til å ta våre TV-opplevelser på iOS og tvOS til nye høyder.


Vi har i dag et høykompetent team som jobber på dette området. Teamet er preget av nysgjerrige og initiativrike personer som er sterke innen sitt fagfelt. De utfordrer og styrker hverandres kompetanse. Teamene er i dag samlokaliserte på vårt hovedkontor på Økern.


Her på Økern jobber vi veldig tett og godt sammen, etter smidige prinsipper og metodikker fra Lean Startup. Det er viktig at du er en utpreget lagspiller, og du må dele vår filosofi rundt smidig arbeidsmåte. Det viktigste er at du er ivrig til å lære, og at du ikke er redd for å prøve og feile før du oppnår det ønskede resultatet.


Kompetanse vi trenger


Et absolutt minimum er erfaring med:



  • App-utvikling

  • Swift og/eller Objective-C (vi bruker Swift)

  • God kjennskap til software design patterns og arkitektur

  • Ryddig og lesbar kode


Videre er det en stor fordel at du har kjennskap til: 



  • Video streaming

  • Continuous integration and delivery


Vi søker deg som har en gründerånd over deg. At du er en pådriver, har stor kapasitet, er kreativ og løsningsorientert er noe vi verdsetter veldig høyt. Til gjengjeld vil vi gi deg stor frihet til å prege både produkt og konsept slik du ønsker.


Av natur er du en som søker tilbakemeldinger fra sluttbrukere og som er komfortabel med å gjennomføre intervjuer, brukertester og målinger av ulike slag og format. Det er viktig for oss at du har gode muntlige fremstillingsevner (norsk og engelsk) og at du har en utpreget analytisk tankegang. 


Du har utdannelse på masternivå med gode karakterer eller erfaring og resultater som oppveier for dette. 


Hva vi tilbyr


Hos oss vil du få en utfordrende og spennende hverdag med produkter som er synlige og engasjerende for brukerne. Vi er en kompetansebedrift med gode utviklingsmuligheter, og vi ønsker å legge til rette for at du skal bli en av de beste i markedet på ditt område. 


Vi holder til i røffe og moderne lokaler på Økern. Her har vi en stor takterrasse med bordtennisbord og vi har en fantastisk kantine med vår egen kokk og shuffleboard. Vi har treningsrom i kjeller og vi har generelt topp moderne møterom. Arbeidsmiljøet hos oss er ungt, godt sosialt og vi har takhøyde.

item.title: C++ Video Streaming at Appear TV (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
The rebirth of TV puts software front and center. At Appear TV we build the technology that allows anyone to receive content on any screen anywhere in the world. A technology that adapts in real-time providing optimal video quality based on available bandwidth. We need skilled C++ developers to join our headquarters in Oslo, Norway. You will be part of a lean product team and take on specific projects, where the cycle from initiation to release is short.


Who are you?



  • You thrive in small agile teams, and aspire to be the team lead

  • You master the art of C++ programming on Linux Servers

  • You get a kick out of optimizing for the latest Intel x86 technology

  • You're an artist when it comes to efficient designs

  • You're self sustained and curious about new technologies

  • You have a Master Degree in Computer Science or equivalent


What you will do in Appear TV


On the First Day, you'll meet the agile team that is responsible for the video streaming product. The tech lead will introduce you to the code base, and the product owner will provide you with a rundown of the overall product portfolio you'll be working on, its market application and business feasibility, as well as ongoing and upcoming releases. Our policy is dive-in, headfirst from Day One.. 


During the First Month, you will participate in the first product sprints. Your contribution to the project will directly affect important features that will be demonstrated to key customers shortly after.


Upon finishing the First Year, you're established as a core team member. Clocking in the first 365, you've made a direct impact on the Appear TV video streamer, and become an integral part of a team that is shaping the future of Internet TV.

item.title: Java and Video Compression at Appear TV (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
At Appear TV we build the technology that allows anyone to receive content on any screen anywhere in the world. A technology that adapts in real-time providing optimal video quality based on available bandwidth. We need skilled Java developers to join our headquarters in Oslo, Norway. You will be part of a lean product team and take on specific projects, where the cycle from initiation to release is short.


Who are you?



  • You get a kick out of Java programming on Linux

  • You're self sustained and curious about new technologies

  • You thrive in small teams, and aspire to some day be the team lead

  • You're an artist when it comes to efficient software algorithms

  • You have a Master Degree in Computer Science or equivalent


What you will do in Appear TV


On the First Day, you'll join a small product team that is responsible for a SW compression solution for data centers. The Java team lead will introduce you to the code base. The product owner will provide you with a rundown of the overall product you'll be working on, its market application and business feasibility, as well as ongoing and upcoming releases. Policy is basically dive-in, headfirst from Day One.. 


During the First Month, you will participate in the first product release. Your contribution will directly affect important features that will be demonstrated to key customers shortly after.


Upon finishing the First Year, you're established as a core team member. Clocking in the first 365, you've made a direct impact on key solutions we provide to some of the largest TV operators in one of the most dominant industries in the world.

item.title: Advanced Analytics and Data Science Manager at NO-Telenor Norge AS (Lysaker, Norway)
item.description:
Do you love getting value from data to transform business results?

Telenor Mobile is searching for an Advanced Analytics and Data Science Manager with first-rate analytics experience and a passion for digital business. We are building a data-driven organization, where this position will play a key role in bringing analytics and data science to the heart of our core operations.

As part of the team in Analytics & CLM (Customer Lifetime Management) you will work with some of the best data scientists in Norway and Telenor Group. With us, you will mine terabytes of data every day. You will run experiments, visualize data and create increasingly sophisticated models to inform data-driven decisions. Sitting at the intersection of all our data, you will have a unique position to create business value.

Our team

The position is organized in the Analytics & CLM unit, responsible for building and deepening a holistic view of Telenor Mobiles customers. We are applying insights, using data and analytics, to drive growth via personalized communication and optimized experiences that fits the customer lifecycle.

The Analytics team enables Telenor Mobile to turn data into action. Using big data platforms, data warehousing and business intelligence technology, advanced analytics, data science, visualization, and self-service analytics, our team supports company efforts to increase revenue, drive subscription growth and enhance consumer engagement.

What you need to succeed
* You are keen to support Telenor Mobile in improving market and sales performance and increased customer experience
* You have an interest in, and understanding of, business requirements and enjoy partnering up with both business managers, data and technology teams to drive knowledge from data into action
* You can transform, cleanse and mine large-scale, complex data sets, visualize them into relevant and useful insights, and present the findings in a compelling story
* You can develop, validate and operationalize advanced analytical algorithms (predictive and prescriptive); including implementation on large scale systems
* You have an understanding of how to design evaluation metrics and innovative experiments that can measure and optimize our campaigns/activities
* You have strong communication skills, and are able to make data science techniques approachable and understandable to non-data scientists
* You are thorough, inquisitive and passionate. You are keen to learn and strive to find new and promising areas for future analyses and the corresponding data requirements

Qualifications
* Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field (statistics, computer science, etc.)
* Industry experience with proven business impact, 2+ years as technical data science expert. A strong inner drive and willingness to learn may compensate for lack of experience
* Expertise in applying statistics or machine learning in a professional or other intensive problem-solving environment with large, complex datasets
* Experience with hypothesis testing, clustering, regression & classification, time series analysis, social network analysis, optimization and/or text analysis
* Experience in statistical programming languages such as SAS, Matlab, R, Python or equivalent
* Expertise in developing, validating and executing algorithms and models on large scale systems
* Experience with cleansing and preparing large, complex datasets for analysis
* Familiarity with data visualization applications, like SAS VA, Tableau or RShiny
* Experience with using big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka or commercial implementations of these) is an advantage
* Domain expertise in CLM/CRM/Sales and marketing optimization/design is an advantage, but not a requirement
* Fluency in a Scandinavian language is an advantage, but not an absolute requirement

We offer
* A great working environment in an enthusiastic and diverse team
* A unique possibility to combine analytics expertise with business problems
* Good pension and insurance benefits
* Cabin rental, sports and interest associations, employee share programme, special discounts etc.
* Flexible working hours

Other information
* Application deadline: 23.03.2018
* Contact person: Kaja Ystgaard, Head of Analytics, Analytics & CLM +47 90692145
* We believe that diverse voices lead to more profound conversations, solutions and results. We are committed to our equal opportunity policy at every selection stage.

We conduct background checks on all relevant candidates through Semac AS, www.semac.no

About Telenor

Telenor Norway AS is the largest provider of telecommunications and data services in the country. Through our mobile and landline network we provide telephony, broadband, and cable TV services to residential and business customers across the country. We also sell services to other telecoms operators. We have 4200 employees working in 30 locations around Norway, including Svalbard. Our head office is located at Fornebu in Bærum. Read more about Telenor Norway at www.telenor.no

Divison Mobile in Telenor Norway is responsible for product development, marketing and sales to mobile customers in the Norwegian private market, for the brands Telenor and Talkmore.

item.title: Senior Angular & .Net Developer at Deltager with Spoortz (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Are you the Angular .NET Developer who will help our platform grow and wants to grow with us? Then Deltager is looking for you!


You will join a business-value focused team that partners with Deltager's marketing team to become a leader in providing online registration platforms driven by best-in-class analytics and innovation.


At Deltager, we aim to be an agile company with a lot of room for (personal) development. We are focused on growth, not just in revenue or size but also in the maturity of our processes.


Job Responsibilities


As  Angular .NET Software Engineer for our storefront squad, you will have overall responsibility for our website. Together with the other members of your cross-functional squad, you will be designing, building and maintaining robust, highly scalable, testable and maintainable solutions, APIs and services. You are a highly skilled professional who is both independent and a great team player. Flexibility and excellent communication skills are a must. You are critical and challenging, but you also know when to let go.


The ideal candidate will be someone who has extensive experience as a .NET engineer in a B2B environment and has excellent knowledge about the technical design of scalable software components and distributed systems. You know how to think customer-centric and out the needs of the customer first.


Recently the team worked on:



  • Implementing a Single Sign-On solution based on OpenID Connect;

  • Adding Track and Trace functionality for our shipments;

  • Adding the ability to save and load products in our HTML5 editors.


Main responsibilities:



  • Design and develop robust, testable and maintainable software solutions;

  • Document software, in particular, business rules and key technical decisions;

  • Ensure that our online platforms run smoothly;

  • Research and make suggestions on how to improve our existing online registration platforms.


Job requirements



  • You have experience in object-oriented programming/design with .NET technology using C#;

  • You have experience with Microsoft web technologies (ASP.NET MVC or Web API);

  • You have experience with SQL Server and ORM framework;

  • You are a valuable team member of an agile team (squad);

  • You write high-quality software and use best practices;

  • You share the responsibility for the work that you do with the team (tribe);

  • You possess a curious and hungry mind, and a passion for code;

  • You have good communication skills, you are smart, savvy, pro-active and get things done;


Desirable



  • Bachelor or Master Degree in computer science/engineering;

  • Knowledge of, or experience with, Continuous Delivery;

  • Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodologies;

  • Experience with TDD, BDD, DDD;

  • You have experience with e-commerce, online registration or similar platforms.

item.title: Systemutvikler at Academic Work (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
LIDENSKAP FOR PROGRAMMERING OG SØKER NYE UTFORDRINGER?


Har du noen års erfaring med systemutvikling og ønsker å fortsette din karriere i et spennende firma? Metafocus søker nye systemutviklere med på laget!



INFORMASJON OM STILLINGEN


Metafocus er i sterk vekst og trenger derfor flere engasjerte medarbeidere til sitt kontor i Oslo. Metafocus er et norsk programvareselskap som er representert i Norge og Sverige.


De utvikler den patenterte programvaren «Digiforms» som de Nordiske kundene baserer forretningskritiske applikasjoner på. Du vil primært jobbe med kunder innen bank og finans. Løsningene omfatter blant annet nettjenester med Bank ID, webapplikasjoner, dokumentproduksjon, selvbetjeningsløsninger og web-portaler. Jobben utføres in-house hos Metafocus i Prinsens gate 2B.


Hos Metafocus vil du bli en del av et engasjerende og faglig dyktig miljø med motiverte medarbeidere. Du vil delta i prosjekter for kjente kunder innen bank og finans og du vil samarbeide tett med dine kolleger. Du vil i stillingen bruke moderne teknologier i en variert hverdag. Mulighet til å påvirke både løsninger for kunder og egen arbeidshverdag er stor. Metafocus gir frihet under ansvar og ønsker å se at sine medarbeidere utvikles og lykkes.


Miljøet i selskapet er innovativt, kreativt og uformelt. Dette er egenskaper som også ønskes hos nye ansatte. Metafocus er opptatt av å ha engasjerte og positive medarbeidere med høyt kundefokus.



ARBEIDSOPPGAVER


Digiforms er Metafocus' kjerneteknologi og du vil få opplæring i både Digiforms og signeringsportalen ‘eSign’. Bruk og underliggende arkitektur samt installasjon gås grundig igjennom. Etter opplæring vil du bli relativt raskt involvert i kundeaktivitetene hvor du får en god forståelse for hva som tidligere har blitt gjort hos kunden og hvilke muligheter det er til videre utvikling.


Etter opplæring vil du blant annet ha følgende oppgaver:



  • Deltagelse som systemutvikler i eksisterende og nye prosjekter og kundeforhold

  • Du vil blant annet besvare spørsmål fra kunden, videreutvikle eksisterende tjenester, og komme med forslag til nye tjenester i samarbeid med prosjektleder, samt råd gi kundene etter beste evne.

  • Installasjon av løsninger og supportoppgaver for kunden.



VI SØKER DEG SOM



  • Har universitets- eller høgskoleutdannelse på bachelor- eller masternivå innen IT. Relevant erfaring kan kompensere for manglende utdanning

  • Kjennskap til Java, XML, Xpath, XSLT og/eller XQuery.

  • 2 års relevant arbeidserfaring

  • Ønsker å skape god kundekontakt og utvikle gode kundeforhold.

  • Har forretningsforståelse

  • Har en god formidlingsevne på norsk og engelsk, både skriftlig og muntlig


For Metafocus er det viktig å få inn en lagspiller som samarbeider godt med resten av teamet og tar eierskap til sine arbeidsoppgaver. Du er ansvarsfull og selvgående og trives med å løse problemstillinger for dine kunder. Du beskriver deg som resultatorientert og motiveres av å nå de målene som er satt. Du ønsker å komme inn i et miljø med motiverte og dyktige medarbeidere og bidrar med engasjement og en positiv innstilling. For Metafocus er det viktig at du er lærevillig og har et stort ønske om utvikle deg som person og faglig.


Høres dette ut som deg? Da ser vi frem til å motta din søkand og CV!



ANNEN INFORMASJON



  • Oppstart: Etter avtale

  • Stillingsprosent: 100 %

  • Lengde på oppdraget: Fast

  • Sted: Oslo


Søknadsfrist: 06.04.18.


Denne rekrutteringen gjennomføres av Academic Work, men du kommer til å bli ansatt hos Metafocus.


Søk på stillingen ved å klikke på Søk nedenfor. Vi vil vurdere søknader fortløpende og anbefaler derfor å sende inn en søknad så snart som mulig.



INFORMASJON OM BEDRIFTEN


Metafocus AS har spesialisert seg på digitalisering og automatisering av tjenester. De designer og bygger webløsninger som integreres mot eksisterende systemer hos kundene. Metafocus håndterer også oppgraderinger og vedlikehold. For å lese mer om bedriften gå inn på: http://www.metafocus.no/

item.title: Senior Backend Developer - Help inspire the future devs of tomorrow at Kudos&Co., Inc. (Asker, Norway)
item.description:
At Kudos you will be part of a family that cherish everyones creative input. You will have the opportunity to grow together with the company, have diverse assignments, experience less bureaucratic boundaries, have fun and explore your limitless capability to achieve great things.


We are seeking people with minimum 3 years of experience, with strong analytical problem solving and communication skills. You have to be a team and result oriented individual with positive attitude and energy.


What you’ll be working on


As a backend developer at Kudos you’ll be responsible for developing new server side software and tools  hosted in Amazon Web Services supporting our app and it's backend systems.


You’ll be working with an agile cross-functional team consisting of skilled Product Managers, UX/UI designers, front and backend developers.


Key Responsibilities



  • Build new microservices and optimising existing ones mainly using Node.js and TypeScript

  • Assist in improving our CI/CD pipeline

  • Contribute to a culture of automated testing

  • Help improving load testing suite

  • Actively contribute towards the committed evolution of our technology stack, to industry best practice

  • Enjoy working with brilliant, fun people!


Skills & Requirements


In addition to a down-to-earth attitude and a desire to continually master your craft you will also bring:



  • A drive to write solid, high-quality and low-maintenance code

  • Understanding of a combination of flavours of modern software development; Agile, BDD, TDD, CI, CD

  • Be comfortable with working both independently and in an agile team

  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English


Bonus Experience



  • Experience working in a fast paced startup environment

  • An understanding of cloud solutions, preferably Amazon Web Services

  • Database experience - Postgres, MongoDB, Redis

  • Knowledge of automatic testing and deployment tools such as Travis and Jenkins

  • Angular JS web framework familiarity

  • Experience with app development, either native or cross platform


If this seems like a good fit for you, we would love to talk to you and perhaps invite you to be a part of this exciting journey with the aim to make a difference.

item.title: Erfaren .NET-webutvikler e-handel at Vertica Danmark (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Har du lyst til å være del av et spennende oppstartsmiljø? Har du lyst til å være med å revolusjonere hvordan folk handler? Har du lyst til å bruke teknologi for å gjøre handleopplevelsen bedre? 


Vertica startet i Norge i mai i år og er nå blitt fire personer. Men vi skal vokse mer! Nå søker vi først og fremst dyktige backendere på .NET. Du har erfaring med webløsninger og helst med eCommerce.


I Danmark har vi over 16 års erfaring med e-handel. Over 80 utviklere og e-handelsrådgivere backer oss opp, og du får muligheten til å jobbe med spennende, ambisiøse kunder som Bolia.com, Br. Dahl og Coop.


Nå bygger vi Norges beste miljø innen e-handel. Vil du være med på reisen?


Vi søker deg som akkurat som oss brenner for webutvikling og setter pris på en sunn bedriftskultur med gode kolleger, sosiale arrangement, høy fleksibilitet og familievennlige rammer.


Du kan forvente en variert hverdag, hvor du (avhengig av din kompetanse og ønsker) bl.a kommer til å:



  • utvikle teknisk komplekse e-handels- og mobilløsninger

  • arbeide tett sammen med erfarne og lidenskapelige .NET-utviklere, frontend-utviklere og User Experience-konsulenter

  • avdekke og spesifisere behov og krav hos våre kunder og utarbeide løsningsforslag

  • arbeide med den nyeste .NET teknologi (C# og ASP.NET MVC), AngularJS, MSSQL, RavenDB, Elastic Search, Mobilutvikling, integrasjoner, Azure, agil utvikling og design patterns m.m.

  • Har du erfaring med Sitecore, Episerver eller Umbraco er det en fordel.


De beste arbeidsvilkårene, tror vi bygges på frihet under ansvar, felles verdier og gjennomsiktighet. Derfor vil du oppleve Vertica som en veldig uformell organisasjon, uten et tradisjonelt hirerarki. Vi har ingen sjefer som skal godkjenne dine ideer før de presenteres for kunden. Og du påvirker i stor grad selv din egen arbeidsdag og arbeidsoppgaver, både fra dag til dag og på lengre sikt, slik at du kan utvikle deg i den retningen du selv ønsker. 


De gode utdannelsesmulighetene som du får adgang til, inkluderer blant annet vårt Vertica Academy, hvor kolleger underviser hverandre i et meget stort utvalg av teknologier, plattformer, utviklingsprinsipper og verktøy. Vi deltar også på konferanser, kurs og tar sertifiseringer. Det er således mulighet for at du kan bygge nye erfaringer, i takt med at din sult på nye utfordringer vokser.


Vil du høre mer om stillingen? Ta kontakt med Steinar, så kan vi ta en uformell prat på telefon eller over en kopp kaffe. 


Kontakt:
Steinar H Nygaard
Tlf: (+47) 98 24 25 58
steinarh@vertica.no

item.title: C++ Developer Disrupting TV at Appear TV (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
The rebirth of TV puts software front and center. Appear TV look to industry trends, and work in lean product teams that take on specific projects. We need skilled developers for the next TV revolution, one where the pixelated dimension is every bit as lifelike as our own.


Who are you?



  • You have a flair for C++ programming on Linux

  • You thrive in small teams, and aspire to be the team lead

  • You get a kick out of the latest generation 64-bit ARM platforms

  • You're self sustained and curious about new technologies

  • You're an artist when it comes to efficient software algorithms


What you will do in Appear TV


On the First Day, you'll join a small product team of four to eight engineers that are passionate about their product. The team lead will introduce you to the code base. The product owner will provide you with a rundown of the overall product you'll be working on, its market application and business feasibility, as well as ongoing and upcoming releases. Policy is basically dive-in, headfirst from Day One.. 


During the First Month, you will participate in the first product release. Your contribution will directly affect important features that will be demonstrated to key customers shortly after.


Upon finishing the First Year, you're established as a core team member. Clocking in the first 365, you've made a direct impact on key solutions we provide to some of the largest TV operators in one of the most dominant industries in the world.

item.title: Data Scientist cutting-edge AI tools for financial news at Exabel (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Explore, build and deploy machine learning models for finding and ranking relevant information from natural language sources, and make models that combine these models with observed time series. Work directly with the Director of Data Science to relate real-world events to effects in the financial markets.


A bit about you



  • You are on top of recent developments in deep learning for natural language processing/generation (question answering and information retrieval are key subareas)

  • You are a creative force who sees opportunities when you see data, and can formulate these into cogent analyses or data and/or machine learning pipelines.

  • You care about communicating your ideas, and you are an active sparring partner on how to use data to create value for users


Desired skills



  • Working experience with pytorch, keras or tensorflow

  • Hands-on experience using deep learning for natural language processing/generation

  • Experience with deploying machine learning services to production systems - preferably using REST or gRPC

  • Knowledge about how recommender systems work

  • Basic (or more) knowledge about reinforcement learning

  • Interest in exploratory data analysis and visualisation


What we offer



  • A uniquely challenging project, delivering high-end AI-based tools for the financial industry.

  • A highly stimulating, cross-functional team environment, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.

  • Opportunity to take part in the company's success through stock incentives.

  • Competitive pay and free lunch every day.

  • Offices in Oslo Science Park, surrounded by other interesting technology companies.

  • Flexibility to work from anywhere part of the time – as long as things get done.

item.title: Front-end Lead - join an international team with unique projects at Bakken & Bæck (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced and talented developer to join and lead our front-end team from Oslo, Amsterdam or Bonn. You will be working on innovative and experimental client projects and ambitious internal products, together with a world-class team of passionate designers and developers.



A bit about you



  • You enjoy building applications for the web, and have been doing so for 5+ years now.

  • You're happy collaborating closely with other developers and designers.

  • You pride yourself in staying at the top of your game by experimenting and testing new web technologies, but are still sensible in the selection of what tech to work with.

  • Passionate about creating excellent user experiences.

  • You enjoy leading and mentoring a team, and are constantly looking for ways to improve collaborative processes.


Skills we are looking for



  • Experience with, and/or a desire to lead a team.

  • Fluent in HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

  • Experience in performance and accessibility work.

  • Good communication skills and experience working directly with clients.

  • Committed to QA and testing.

  • A keen eye for good design is a bonus.

item.title: iOS Lead - join an international team with unique projects at Bakken & Bæck (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced iOS developer to lead our team in Oslo, Amsterdam or Bonn. You will get the opportunity to work with some of the finest talents in the industry on innovative and ambitious projects and products together with challenging clients.


About you:



  • You enjoy building applications for iOS, and have been doing so for 5+ years now.

  • You're happy collaborating closely with other developers and designers.

  • Passionate about creating excellent user experiences.

  • You enjoy leading and mentoring a team, and are constantly looking for ways to improve collaborative processes.



Skills we are looking for:



  • Experience with, and/or a desire to lead a team.

  • Interest in Swift, usability and communicating with Web services such as REST and Websockets.

  • Self-sustaining and forever curious.

  • Good communication skills and experience working directly with clients.

  • Committed to QA, code reviews and testing.

  • A keen eye for good design is a bonus.

item.title: Junior JavaScript Software Engineer at Genus (Lysaker, Norway)
item.description:
Are you passionate about JavaScript? Do you want to work in a fast growing Norwegian software company, with great opportunities to influence your own professional development as well as your organization?


Help us build the next version of Genus Apps; a no-code software development tool used by our customers to create innovative apps for web and desktop. In other words: we make a development tool that helps others create apps without the need for programming.


Our tool is used by large corporations for business-critical solutions within corporate performance management (CPM), resource management, business intelligence (BI), and more. The tool may be installed on premises, at third party hosting providers or in the cloud (Azure).


Your task will be to experiment with new technologies, determine how new building blocks can be added to our tool, and to program these building blocks. Your task will not be to maintain old code, but to create new code on new technologies.


We are adding new members to our team of JavaScript developers, and are looking for those who would like to be part of our highly skilled team of specialists delivering cutting edge software!


Typical activities for this position include:



  • Programming in JavaScript

  • Programming either client-side, server-side or both

  • Analysis of new technology and design how this fits into our tool

  • Architecture and design


We offer:



  • Exciting and challenging work in a growing company

  • Large and solid customers, both in Norway and internationally

  • Training and professional development in relevant technologies

  • Ability to shape the company and your own career


Skills & requirements:



  • Analytical and self-organized

  • Master or Bachelor of Science degree (or similar) with higher than average academic results in programming technologies

  • Strong and proven passion for programming, shown through programming projects of various sizes carried out before, during or after your formal education, in your spare time or otherwise. Show us your projects!

  • Preferably experience with JavaScript (front-end and / or server-side)

  • Preferably experience with HTML and CSS

  • Determination to continue your professional development as a programmer

  • Both graduates and experienced programmers are encouraged to apply

  • Highly proficient in spoken and written English


Your application should contain an application letter, your CV and your academic transcripts.

item.title: QA Engineer - Global Health Platform at University of Oslo (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
DHIS 2 is a web-based, open source data platform used by governments, international development agencies and NGOs in more than 60 countries worldwide. The system is used to improve access and use of information within health, education, sanitation, nutrition, disaster relief and other domains. The platform has become a global standard within international development and has a huge impact on the way health systems are being managed.


DHIS 2 is changing the way developing countries and NGOs manage their health systems and programs through a world class data platform. We work on projects with global reach and scale, such as:



  • Disease surveillance and monitoring in collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

  • HIV/AIDS control in collaboration with PEPFAR, the largest initiative ever for combating a single disease.

  • Health information management systems with more than 60 ministries of health worldwide, including South Africa, Tanzania, Ghana and Cambodia.

  • Program monitoring and evaluation with more than 70 NGOs such as Medecins Sans Frontieres, Save the Children, and PSI.


As a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer you will be responsible for all aspects of automated testing, including planning, creating, implementation and execution of tests for the core platform. You will work closely with our QA team members and our software engineering team to ensure that we are delivering high quality software to our users. You will use your knowledge of test automation to influence better software design, code testability and proper engineering practices.


Responsibilities



  • Create detailed and well-structured test plans and test cases

  • Prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities

  • Design, develop and execute automation test scripts using open source tools

  • Build testing tools as required to improve test coverage


Qualifications



  • Proven work experience in software quality assurance

  • Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes

  • Experience with testing web-based software

  • Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases

  • Hands-on experience with automated testing tools

  • Solid experience in scripting in any of Python, Javascript or Java


Location


Preferably you will be working out of the Oslo (Norway) office. Alternatively you can work remotely with occasional trips to Oslo. We offer flexible working hours. Please indicate in the application whether you are available for on-site work.

item.title: Hei frontender! Er du lei av møter? at Fiken AS (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Kjeder du deg litt på jobb? Føler du at for mange møter tar tid du egentlig kunne brukt til å fikse problemet? Blir ikke produktet helt hva det kunne vært fordi mange skal si sitt, men ingen egentlig setter seg inn i det som skal løses?


Har du lest så langt så håper vi du bruker to minutter til og gjør noe med det. Livet er for kort for dårlig kode – derfor startet vi Fiken. Vi tror vi gjør mye riktig – og har gått fra 0 til 17.000 kunder på tre år. Vi trenger ikke strøkne skjorter, mer eller mindre meningsløse intervjuer, eller lange søknader. Det holder med et Hei så tar vi det derfra.


Fortsatt her? Bra! Det vi ser etter er rett og slett deg – en flink frontend-utvikler som har lyst til å jobbe med et produkt og være kreativ for å lage noe brukerne elsker.

Vi tror mer på å tilpasse jobben til personen enn omvendt, men i utgangspunktet tror vi at: 


Du som frontend-utvikler er



  • Faglig dyktig
    Med det mener vi "godt over gjennomsnittet", men vi synes det er positivt om du også har andre interesser enn jobb. Du er erfaren nok til å vite at det å lage det beste produktet ofte handler om å stille de riktige spørsmålene.

  • Glad i å eksperimentere
    Du synes det er spennende å utforske og teste, med mye tid og rom for læring. Du liker å jobbe smidig og uformelt, og er glad i å diskutere både med designere og de lenger ned i stacken. Selvsagt vet du også at kode og design aldri er ferdig.

  • Motivert av å jobbe med produkt
    I Fiken tenker vi produkt først, og teknologi/verktøy etterpå. Vi elsker å være kreative rundt produktet, og komme opp med nye løsninger på gamle problemer. Det er derfor en fordel om du liker å sette deg inn i, og forstå hva brukeren tenker og trenger. 

  • Erfaren i noen (men ikke nødvendigvis alle) teknologier 
    HTML, Javascript, AngularJS, CSS, Bootstrap.


Du som menneske er



  • Stolt av det du lager
    I Fiken er vi genuint opptatt av å gjøre hverdagen enklere for alle små bedrifter der ute. Vi legger alle tilbakemeldinger ut på Slack, og legger mye prestisje i å kunne føle stolthet over det vi lager. Ja, penger er viktig, men produktet er viktigere. 

  • Litt lei møter og byråkrati
    Vi tror gode produkter blir til om man faktisk har tid til å lage de. Derfor er vi opptatt av å fjerne så mye støy som mulig, slik at man som utvikler kan utvikle. Vi snakker sammen, men da er vi mer glade i spontane diskusjoner enn planlagt tid i kalenderen.

  • Nysgjerrig på det å jobbe i et oppstartsmiljø
    Å jobbe i en oppstart er fantastisk moro, men innebærer ofte lange dager og mye usikkerhet. Fiken er unike, og kan gi deg oppstartsopplevelsen i en sikker arbeidsplass med normal arbeidstid. Hørte vi Ole Brumm?


I Fiken får du 



  • Trivsel – for alle i Fiken føles dette som verdens beste arbeidsplass.

  • Et liv utenom, med gode betingelser i et solid selskap.

  • Stolthet og mening i arbeidet.

  • Frihet til å skape.



Vi du vite mer om oss og det vi tror på? Nevnte vi at vi er opptatt av brukerne våre? De har også skrevet litt.

item.title: Hei utvikler! Er du lei av møter? at Fiken AS (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Kjeder du deg litt på jobb? Føler du at mye av tiden går bort til møter du egentlig kunne brukt til å fikse problemet? Blir ikke produktet helt hva det kunne vært fordi mange skal si sitt, men ingen egentlig setter seg inn i det som skal løses?


Har du lest så langt så håper vi du bruker to minutter og gjør noe med det. Livet er for kort for dårlig kode – derfor startet vi Fiken. Vi tror vi gjør mye riktig, og har gått fra 0 til 17.000 kunder på tre år. Vi trenger ikke strøkne skjorter, mer eller mindre meningsløse intervjuer eller lange søknader. Det holder med et Hei så tar vi det derfra.


Fortsatt her? Bra! Det vi ser etter er rett og slett deg – en flink fullstack utvikler som har lyst til å jobbe med et produkt og være kreativ for å lage noe brukerne elsker. 

Vi tror mer på å tilpasse jobben til personen enn omvendt, men i utgangspunktet tror vi at: 


Du som utvikler er



  • Faglig dyktig
    Med det mener vi "godt over gjennomsnittet", men vi synes det er positivt om du også har andre interesser enn jobb. Du er erfaren nok til å vite at det å lage det beste produktet ofte handler om å stille de beste spørsmålene.

  • Komfortabel med hele stacken
    Du trenger ikke være like god på alt, men det er viktig at du kan ta et helhetlig ansvar for en ny feature fra SQL til HTML. Du har meninger og erfaring om hvordan ting skal være teknisk, men er ikke religiøs på det. 

  • Motivert av å jobbe med produkt
    I Fiken tenker vi produkt først – og teknologi/verktøy etterpå. Vi elsker å være kreative rundt produktet, og komme opp med nye løsninger på gamle problemer. Det er derfor en fordel om du liker å sette deg inn i, og forstå, hva brukeren tenker og trenger.

  • Erfaren i noen (men ikke nødvendigvis alle) teknologier som Java, Kotlin, Spring, Hibernate, Postgres/SQL, Javascript, AngularJS, CSS, Bootstrap.


Du som menneske er



  • Stolt av det du lager
    I Fiken er vi genuint opptatt av å gjøre hverdagen enklere for alle små bedrifter der ute. Vi legger alle tilbakemeldinger ut på Slack, og legger mye prestisje i å kunne føle stolthet over det vi lager. Ja, penger er viktig, men produktet er viktigere. 

  • Litt lei møter og byråkrati
    Vi tror gode produkter blir til om man faktisk har tid til å lage de. Derfor er vi opptatt av å fjerne så mye støy som mulig, slik at man som utvikler kan utvikle. Vi snakker sammen, men da er vi mer glad i spontane diskusjoner enn planlagt tid i kalenderen.

  • Nysgjerrig på det å jobbe i et oppstartsmiljø
    Å jobbe i en oppstart er fantastisk moro, men innebærer ofte lange dager og mye usikkerhet. Fiken er unike, og kan gi deg oppstartsopplevelsen i en sikker arbeidsplass med normal arbeidstid. Hørte vi Ole Brumm?


I Fiken får du 



  • Trivsel – for alle i Fiken føles dette som verdens beste arbeidsplass.

  • Et liv utenom, med gode betingelser i et solid selskap.

  • Stolthet og mening i arbeidet.

  • Frihet til å skape.



Vi du vite mer om oss og det vi tror på? Nevnte vi at vi er opptatt av brukerne våre? De har også skrevet litt.

item.title: Senior full-stack web dev cutting-edge AI tools for finance at Exabel (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
We are looking for a full-stack developer to join our team in Oslo. You will be working closely with product developers, data scientists, engineers and designers to deliver a high-end product for the finance industry.


We are still building the core team, and are looking for experienced developers that are excited about being part of shaping the company and the product.


As a full-stack web developer, you’ll be responsible for delivering high-quality, scalable, production-ready code for our software platform, fulfilling desired functionality according to our product roadmap. We take pride in our code, and follow best practices when it comes to automated testing, code reviews, version control, and maintainability.


A bit about you



  • You love coding.


  • You have 5+ years of experience delivering quality large-scale applications for the web.




  • You love a good digital product, and strive to create excellent user experiences.




  • You are on top of the latest web technologies, both front-end and back-end, and you are able to consider which technologies are appropriate for a given situation.




Desired skills




  • Fluent in CSS, HTML and JavaScript.




  • Familiarity with API design and developing SDKs in JavaScript.




  • Experience with developing REST or gRPC based services.




  • Experience with data modeling and architecture development for web applications.




  • Familiarity with DevOps tools and practices relevant to web development.




  • Fluent in one or more back-end languages, like Java, Scala, Python etc.




  • Familiarity with web security and identity management.




What we offer




  • A uniquely challenging project, delivering high-end AI-based tools for the financial industry.



  • A highly stimulating, cross-functional team environment, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.


  • Opportunity to take part in the company's success through stock incentives.



  • Competitive pay and free lunch every day.




  • Offices in Oslo Science Park, surrounded by other interesting technology companies.




  • Flexibility to work from anywhere – as long as things get done.




Our software backend is running in the Google Cloud. The core is a gRPC-based Istio service mesh running on the Google Container Engine, with Cloud Storage, App Engine, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, and open-source components Apache Kafka and Druid. We use primarily Java for our software infrastructure, and Python for mathematical modelling and data science.


On the front-end, we have a React single-page web app, and a native Swift iOS mobile app. The backend is accessed through Cloud Endpoints, with Auth0 authentication.


If possible, please include links to demos, screen recordings, or case studies in your application. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Front-End Software Engineer - Global Health Data Platform at University of Oslo (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
DHIS 2 software engineers develop a platform used to improve health care at a global scale. We work directly with end-users in order to understand how our system is being used. DHIS 2 developers work in small teams and have great impact on the product. We are seeking a software engineer who is passionate about developing elegant, high-performance web applications.


DHIS 2 is a web-based, open source data platform used by governments, international development agencies and NGOs in more than 60 countries worldwide. The system is used to improve access and use of information within health, education, sanitation, nutrition, disaster relief and other domains. The platform has become a global standard within international development and has a huge impact on the way health systems are being managed.


DHIS 2 is changing the way developing countries and NGOs manage their health systems and programs through a world class data platform. We work on projects with global reach and scale, such as:



  • Disease surveillance and monitoring in collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). DHIS 2 is used to notify the right people about possible disease outbreaks so that action can be taken in time.

  • HIV/AIDS control in collaboration with PEPFAR, the largest initiative ever for combating a single disease. DHIS 2 is used to collect data and provide analytics and insights into how funding can be spent most effectively.

  • Health information management systems with more than 60 ministries of health worldwide, including South Africa, Tanzania, Ghana and Cambodia. DHIS 2 is used to collect and analyze data for areas such as service utilization, family planning and immunization.

  • Program monitoring and evaluation with more than 70 NGOs such as Medecins Sans Frontieres, Save the Children, and PSI. DHIS 2 is used to analyse the impact of programs, improve planning and guide resource utilization.


At DHIS 2 you will specialize in building software features for the DHIS 2 open source platform. You will work on features related to analytics, information retrieval, metadata management, offline data collection and data synchronization. The role requires a passion and ability for finding innovative engineering solutions to complex problems.


At our team you will be part of the software design process and have great influence on the end product. We give you the vision and the challenge - you have the freedom to choose your own approach to problem solving. And of course, you can pick your hardware, tools and software of choice. We are transitioning our front-end to React / Redux so you will be working on the latest frameworks.


Our platform is built API-first with an extensible app architecture. We do continuous delivery and short iterations. You can find our source code on GitHub. Check out the backend repository and a typical front-end app repository.


Skills & Requirements



  • Expert knowledge of Javascript.

  • Expert knowledge of web technologies (HTML/CSS).

  • Aware of Javascript frameworks (any of React, Angular, Prototype or similar).

  • Experience working with REST Web APIs and JSON.

  • 3+ years of experience building rich web applications.


Location


Preferably you will be working out of the Oslo (Norway) office. Alternatively you can work remotely with occasional trips to Oslo. We offer flexible working hours. Please indicate in the application whether you are available for on-site work.

item.title: Java Developer at FINN.no (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
Our developers work on everything from web, microservices, messaging-systems to machine learning and recommendations. FINNs frontendtechnology is mainly JavaScript. We use Node.js and React, but do also write a lot of VanillaJS. Our backend is mainly written in Java with some parts written in Scala. We have native apps on the iOS and Android platforms. 


We strive to make good websites on all devices with modular loosely coupled code of high quality. With continuous deployment, Docker and Kubernetes we release code to production around 1000 times a week.


If possible we try to use open standards and are pragmatic regarding new frameworks and technology. 


Skills & Requirements


We are looking for more developers with a passion for great technical solutions and good user experiences. You need to be passionate about your work and about learning new skills. We work in agile teams so the ability to function well and contribute in your team is imperative. 


To be able to make a product for all and to achieve a good working environment, we value diversity.
